result.execSummary:
The defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine (2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to count 2 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations.
- No contact with firearms.

- Complete Thinking for a Change Course.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Provide DNA Sample.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count 1 and to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keotis Tarnell Hamilton

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  sentence credit.  (Keotis T. Hamilton - #574248, Prairie du Chien Correctional Institution, 500 E Parrish St, Prairie du Chien WI 53821).
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
Received and Filed. Notice of right to seek post conviction relief

Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Keotis Tarnell Hamilton.  Student Intern Levi Keeku appeared in court under the supervision of Attorney Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. ifor State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to count 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

As to Count 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 years, concurrent to count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, with random urine screens.
- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- Complete Thinking for a Change Course.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for expungement.

*Court finds defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

OFF THE RECORD- 
Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton not in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Keotis Tarnell Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced for this hearing due to institutional zoom connection issues. Court adjourns matter for an additional plea/sentencing hearing date to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Received and Filed.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Keotis Tarnell Hamilton.  Attorney Annie Louk for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requested adjournment due to needing more time; court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; Defendant to appear by ZOOM. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Letter from Defendant ( Keotis Hamilton # 574248 Prairie Du Chien Correctional Institution 500 Parrish St Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821)

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen Jr. appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Defense has discovery and is waiting on an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton in custody.  Franceso Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keotis Tarnell Hamilton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Keotis Tarnell Hamilton not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4/4/2022.  Defendant is in custody at Oregon Correctional. Needs to be produced for court.
